intro: Homalium parkeri, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows as a medium to large shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
